a0SI5hAlqPmBPfKiLmSwlw.text: I am a true fan of Bon Gusto.  The wait staff are very friendly and Italian!!  Service was a bit slow, but they were busy and only had one person working the floor.  But, for the food and coffee, it's worth it.   I strongly encourage you to stop in and say hello and enjoy a nice Cappuccino!

5ES2uOI2kYfsq2i--qu2pg.text: Every morning I was greeted with friendly smiles and with the best latte I've ever had. The staff was so friendly. My children enjoyed the fresh squeezed orange juice and like I said I was servedthe best latte ever had. I highly recommend this little café!!!

lWDuKtNIJ8HDQvch4Atvqw.text: Excellent food. Nice location. We had the marguerite pizza, ravioli Fantasia, risotto porcini, and the Caesar salad. All were incredible. I wished we could've continued eating without getting full. There was so much chicken on the salad and the risotto plate was very filling for a man. The interior was light with Roman artwork. Very rich cheesy ravioli. The pizza was about 15" diameter and my 11 year old ate it all and scarfed down garlic bread afterward. Tempted to get desserts too. The bill came up to £50 which seemed like a lot for lunch, but seems to be the standard in London.

tR_cSTunkvoFAnd0MGS-7g.text: We had several breakfasts in the cafe. The food is great. Price is very reasonable. Great service as well.

qKFIToimMxfZqiUSQv-FzA.text: Delicious and very reasonably priced! The staff was very nice and attentive. The food came out quick as well. I would keep trying other places since I'm visiting but if I get hungry again in the morning and don't know where to go, I wouldn't mind stopping by again.

gj8kf80IWIc1C6Bqe_iIBQ.text: The steak sandwich was great. Even the service provided was good.

9W4Mkc8oHCgVd1QYFnazyQ.text: when I have visited this place it has been for take away only but what a fantastic take away! The paninis are scrumptious and filling while being inexpensive at under a fiver. If you're around and fancy a delicious treat that won't cost a tenner and leave you hungry, grab lunch here!

vZqnFOiz51sdrCUrszV9oQ.text: Great food and excellent service. This is one of my favourite cafes in the area.

Ils9KYv1AzEqgJggakhRYw.text: This is one of my locals for a quick lunch. A classic local Italian bar, looking pretty much like it would if it was in Italy. Good pannini, mainly toasted, some pasta to take away as well but you have to wait. There is a cafe side and a restaurant side were you can have lunch for less than £15 with a pasta, a drink and a coffee. The deco is not great but it has character. The place is always busy and buzzy. Italian staff mainly so get ready to talk football (perfect if you support Juventus in Italy and Arsenal in the UK). They are always friendly, except when Italy loses against France. I have been going there less for the past couple of years. Maybe because each time I go now they talk about the last World Cup

ekWt_KDoa203an01ebxY8g.text: This is an absolutely lovely little independent café, we have sat outside in the summer time and have enjoyed many lazy brunches over newspapers. The place is very small with only one large table inside and a few niches outside. The owner is super friendly and is very helpful and informative. The food is Italian homemade style, and is all delicious, especially the fab eggs benedict. The coffee is also out of this world. This is a great friendly and relaxed place. It is away from the hustle and bustle of Notting Hill and is a bit of an insiders secret.

82YH8No0uX6xLz24Cd13Mg.text: We went here for breakfast. Very good. We ordered the eggs, all different kinds. Fresh juice was yummy.  The panini sandwiches were awesome. Highly recommend them. The cappuccino coffee was really really good. Don't know their secret but my husband and I have never had a cup so good.

vQORT-FfkHVR_by_C8Q0eQ.text: Firstly, I'll start by saying that the food and service was excellent. I had the spaghetti carbonara, with bruschetta. The staff were friendly and efficient, and pleasant as anything. The venue missed out on five stars, as the family owning the restaurant appeared to be having a blazing row, whilst I ate my food. This was explained to me as 'Italian people.' I recommend the place for food, but if you're looking to relax, from what they were discussing, these arguments might be frequent over the next few months, so be prepared.

photos.caption: Photo of Bon Gusto - London, United Kingdom. Spaghetti carbonara

SN0Bnxk4vWkTl9qj-4BlzA.text: We came to Bon Gusto around 10:30 am after an overnight flight. I wanted breakfast but my husband wanted pizza. Even though it was not their usual lunchtime they were very accommodating. They fixed his pizza which he thoroughly enjoyed!  Came back for dinner the next night. Had an equally lovely experience. Would highly recommend.

6h45QK5WiXC8VTLt3sZUSg.text: i tried this place last month as i was in the area and decided to use my Yelp app to find a good value, tasty cafe.I'm so glad i did, i chose the seafood rissotto and it was a fantastic choice. Hot tasty and yummy all in one. Perfect for this weather. It had a good amount of seafood to rice ratio.I also tried the calamari starter - they didnt have the item listed on the blackboard but they made me a plate of fried calamari - nice and crispy but could have done with a bit of seasoning

photos.caption: Photo of Bon Gusto - London, United Kingdom. A very tasty seafood risotto
Photo of Bon Gusto - London, United Kingdom. Calamari served with a king prawn topping

q_Kaz-cKS3utk9tmzi4SEg.text: We've just moved offices to the area so I'm still feeling my way around the new lunch scene - based on previous reviews I decided that Bon Gusto would be my first visit.Brief summary - it was alright. I decided to get a takeaway but I was standing there for a good five minutes before a staff member spoke to me because there was some confusion about whether I was part of a larger group. That's all fine and forgiven.I ordered spaghetti to take away, which took a while - but I'll attribute that to them actually cooking the pasta to order rather than just microwaving a bowl of it. So some credit due there. As for the pasta, it was fine. It was a red sauce with some meat rather than a proper meat ragu. So all in all, it was fine with some concessions. But that's it.

ROnfr0wnVCW88pyChWnOsg.text: Found this place walking in a heavy rain.  Glad I stopped.  Good atmosphere not to loud.   Broccoli soup and bruschetta you start both were great.   Lasagna for main course one of beast I've ever had.   Highly recommend this place for dinner.

NMW3awipcyRfO7Zk0qOYZw.text: The breakfast was terrible, I got eggs Benedict and the hollandaise is not real, it was cold out of a jar. Steer clear!

LuOYXhsyfIVY9GJZ70Oq2g.text: Had breakfast and dinner at Bon Gusto this week. Top notch. Service was superb and the food at both meals was delicious. The linguine with scallops, which was a dinner special, was extraordinary. Friendly folks that go all out to please. Highly recommended.

yN-7Pu8QMd3NQpofTQ1V0g.text: This was my first meal when I visited London back in December. I got the American pancakes that came with eggs and bacon. Of course I should have known better the pancake was a crepe the eggs where too soft for my liking and the bacon was Canadian bacon. The crepe and bacon was delicious I would visit again minus the eggs.

cnP-iMV-rZgIl3-vGDD6iw.text: I asked for an item not in the menu and they were able to accommodate. The pasta was really fresh and the service was very friendly.

9aSVNvcK7nv-zZ450xYonQ.text: Ate here on vacation from USA with my parents. My mother is from Santa Elia, Sicily. My mother got to speak to our waitress in Italian and have a great chat with all the staff (we went on off hours).We had the English breakfast but the menu is distinctly Italian. Great atmosphere. Great people. Excellent conversation. To our waitress (it's been a month....Marianna?) your English was very good, your service superb, and you should get your mother to take the train to London. Thank you for the amazing food and service.

HXWpVvP1VqN1Ai82HxlxwA.text: Great fresh food! Had two kids with us and everyone found something on the menu they liked. Very nice atmosphere. We had the spaghetti bolognese, caprese mozarella, chicken dish with ham and white wine sauce. If you order the garlic bread appetizer and from the US, it's not like the garlic bread we know. Basically a pizza crust with a lot of spices. Not bad, just not what we expected and ordered it for the kids to tide them over until dinner. Highly recommend this place, especially if traveling with kids.

vjWcgRq40gbPLiu-pGVYiw.text: What a great little local breakfast and coffee spot. Excellent cappuccino. Super friendly too. If you're staying at the Taj, pop across the street and give them a try.

g1kDpstiDIexgwPrBNUJ5Q.text: Great food, great coffee, and AMAZING staff! I went for breakfast and ordered the eggs and pancetta, thinking pancetta was a type of cheese. Silly me, I know, but when the food came out and I saw the meat on top of my food I realized the mistake I made :/ I'm a vegetarian and apologized a lot and was definitely willing to pay for my mistake, but she brought out the vegetarian breakfast and made light of it all by telling me if I apologized one more time I wouldn't get any breakfast :P the waitress was amazing and funny and she really made a great impression. I really appreciated her understanding and would definitely go back!

DbOIdj6EwGVdPyXf_8v5vQ.text: Very bad service. Our waitress understood minimal English. It took 30 minutes to bring a sandwich-the wrong sandwich. Each person in our party received their food 20 minutes apart. They didn't start making some of our sandwiches until part of our party was finished eating. The sandwiches were not worth the wait. Very disappointing and we were looking for a quick eat. Not sure if it was just the waitress or the restaurant. Either way I would never go back or recommend this place for brunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Bon Gusto - London, United Kingdom. White americano

-2M7H2BIRcVG_mftfOPomw.text: We came here randomly one afternoon to grab a quick bite. I would have rated the experience higher, as the paninis looked gorgeous, all toasted with their proper Italian ingredients on fancy olive buns. The Englishman and I each ordered the Parma ham panini. I didn't get Parma ham. I don't know what kind of ham it was, but it certainly wasn't what I thought I was getting, while the Englishman happily chowed down on his panini with real Parma ham. What gives?! Who serves two people who are dining together, who order the exact same thing, something different with no explanation? It's always better to acknowledge something like that upfront. Also the toilet was a scary experience. I really wish I could rate it higher as this little restaurant had so much potential.

sBGdq7KoaW8gCpiC8qa3zg.text: Cute cafe on the way to Buckingham palace.Stopped here for lunch right before visiting. Small quaint but nice cafe. Food was very good and fairly fast service, wide variety of items on the menu. Good place to eat for a family meal, Bruch with a friend, or just getting coffee. Overall good place to eat! I would recommend if you're looking for a place near Buckingham!

photos.caption: Photo of Bon Gusto - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bon Gusto - London, United Kingdom

RTduw4mhdApNNrmUcwvGlA.text: Without any advance information, we immediately got the impression this restaurant was an authentic Italian cafe in the heart of London. We were not disappointed. Our dinner of fresh gnocchi with tomato sauce, Caesar salad and a tasty pizza convinced we must have landed in Florence or Rome instead of London. Bon Gusto is a truly great find for dinner!

lVXOFiDSLO_aPKu_dc1jvw.text: This is a great little lunch spot, with fast service and a good quality of food. I came here recently and had a nice chicken breast sandwich (unfortunately my first choice had run out that day!), and only realised as I was leaving that I'd actually been there before, two years back with my family. We'd sat inside in the restaurant area for some pre-Buckingham Palace food. This time, I only popped in to look at the menu and get food - which turned up and was great. Being sat outside had upsides (the sun! a breeze!) but also downsides (taxi fumes and tourist herds passing by), but out-or-in, it's a nice spot. I'd recommend this over the Royal Quarter Cafe (just opposite) for price, taste and portion size.It is definitely "tired" inside, but for a quick (or not-so-quick) lunch spot, you can easily get over that and just enjoy your food.

gUL3YmvbsP-vgOC40FB6zg.text: If you love everything Italian, thus is your cafe. Everyone who works here is from Italy, and I believe almost everything in the cafe as well lol.      I had a breakfast sandwich and a cappuccino, both delicious.      If you're by Buckingham Palace, this place is a five minute walk away.  The perfect stop to take a break after seeing the sites in the area.

cnAoKy1r5guDzGg8kRqb_A.text: We were walking around Buckingham Palace and looking for a place for dinner. Came across this restaurant and decided to give it a shot.Loved the place. Nice ambience. Good food. Great hostess.

0VU3RRNnEUD9v8itXLoR0g.text: Walked in and ordered for takeout. The place seems nice inside and has a relaxing atmosphere but I didn't venture into the main dining area. I ordered a caesar salad, garlic bread, and olives. Everything was fresh and delicious and my order was ready to go in less than 10 minutes. Service was friendly and polite.I always have a hard time choosing restaurants when I'm really hungry because I worry I'll be disappointed. If I haven't been there before, haven't heard good reviews, or haven't been recommended by a friend, I usually won't eat dinner at a random place.Although I only ordered a salad and some extras, I can tell by what I ate that the quality of their food is very good. I wish I had the time to dine in and try some of their wines.

MhaAvIdLArI5Rq-6iZ-8sA.text: Very nice place located very close to Buckingham palace. We stopped into this restaurant after having been at the changing of the guard. It caught my eye because of how nice the appearance of this restaurant was. The three of us sat down and ordered some still water and a couple of Pepsi's. We decided to just ordered one pizza (Bon Gusto) and split it between the three of us because we had a reservation later in the day and we didn't want to be stuffed. Let me just say the waiter who had been serving us was super nice and understanding. When he brought the pizza over he had already cut it into pieces for us to share. We thought this was really considerate because they are smaller pizzas not meant to be shared. The pizza was delicious. I prefer thin pizzas that are coal fired. I find that you can always taste more flavors and they're not overrun by the dough. Very nice experience and very nice staff.

photos.caption: Photo of Bon Gusto - London, United Kingdom. Vegetable extract lol
Photo of Bon Gusto - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bon Gusto - London, United Kingdom

KSh91h8L0UoNFLqapLcfFg.text: Had a lovely dinner at this little hidden gem. Cute little Italian restaurant, lovely staff and delicious food. I had a veal dish which was cooked to perfection. Others in my group had lasagna and and chicken saltinboca and everyone was happy with their choices.  Added bonus was we were able to hear each other talk!  Music in the background was nice but not very loud as we have found in a lot of restaurants here in London.

WYurZNtCe-zdJtQCrhPQsQ.text: The five of us enjoyed our meals. We shared a couple pizzas and the gnocchi...it was very good. The service was excellent and quick. The food was hit with all of us. Great place...go find it.

pLv9qNNhD-ezICVQbFqyyw.text: This place is off Buckingham Gate.  It was recommended by the hotel staff at Conrad Saint James. You wouldn't think you would get a full English breakfast at an Italian restaurant. The food is great.  Glad we stopped here. We had the full English breakfast and eggs Benedict. Eggs in the English breakfast were made from farm fresh eggs and were seasoned with fresh Orange juice is fresh squeezed.

ATqZvrouIaRhbJtdGj_bfQ.text: Great food, relaxing atmosphere The pizza was exactly how I would prefer, no tomato sauce. Risotto and Cabonarra are also very good

qyfyDzg9ZI0DaqnTWLCI3g.text: We really enjoyed this place! We came into town, tired from traveling all day and Bon Gusto hit the spot. It was really busy when we walked in and they couldn't accommodate us but the host promised that if we came back in 20 minutes, they would have a spot. They did. Our server, Marcheto, was wonderful. So kind and very quick! Food was great...we ordered two pizzas and some pastas. The 1/2 bottle of Peppoli Chianti was perfect for our table. We will stop by again before we leave London!

2c8DErw4tcdDsBSmF4B73A.text: Great meal with beautiful ingredients.  Went with four people and everyone got something different.  All was delicious.  Fresh and lovely green salad, wonderful pasta and heavenly chocolate mousse for dessert.  A great meal.

eI4dV1vPUlggChe9AaVaQg.text: The perfect meal to the start of a day.  I ordered the English breakfast and it was both sweet and savory.  Although this is a Italian restaurant, when in Rome...The meal consist of two over easy eggs, 2 strips of beacon, 2 toasts, 1 sausage, tomatoes and mushrooms.  A very large meal indeed.I have never been a fan of tomatoes however, having them perfectly pan-siered with a hit of salt gave it a perfect consistency.  Recommend to all!!

SxyMEm56ggIzZw5ZT32x6g.text: Easily the best meal we had in London. The service is attentive with excellent suggestions. The starters are flavorful & perfectly prepared. When asked to pair a cold white wine on a terribly hot day with a Spaghetti carbonara, a lovely lemony, minerally wine was suggested. The lasagna was a generous & delicious portion and the Saltimboca was tender and moist.

lPHsOtjjfSPubAyielO5bQ.text: Had a lovely dinner here at the recommendation of our concierge... Mariana was a fantastic server although she did dial down the spicy on my pizza, which was probably to my benefit.. owner brought us a couple shots on the house for our honeymoon... a great way to finish an excellent meal.  Would return 100% !

photos.caption: Photo of Bon Gusto - London, United Kingdom. Just getting started !

Y4mlV0ZLMrWRBKYwsMTgrQ.text: Utterly amazing. The food is outstanding, the server remembered our visit from 8 months ago! Recently renovated, the place matches the quality of the food. Exceptional.

4Ds3zhayPUDHD75g9Xc4ig.text: Bon Gusto is one of London's hidden gems. The pasta dishes rival some of the food we ate in Italy. The price is very reasonable and the restaurant has a great atmosphere.I highly recommend giving this a try.

gXbmww9PIJDbwif9V1wAYw.text: Nice breakfast.  Cheering pop music gives you a good mood in the morning along with the smell of coffee haha

photos.caption: Photo of Bon Gusto - London, United Kingdom

VUXWyu75qt4ZIjx8YB4Xww.text: We started with the caprese salad along with another salad that also included avocado.   Both were amazing and improved with the provided balsamic and olive oil.   For entrees we had one of the specials with clams and fresh tomatoes.  Along with that we enjoyed spaghetti Bolognesse, pepperoni pizza and another fantastic special. Great service and clearly fresh ingredients make this a nice restaurant on the corner.

FXQYyApdjN0Vf7t-5XYhQA.text: Great little neighborhood place.  Was out for a walk with my family last week, stopped in for a late evening meal, just some pizza and a few glasses of wine, and the food & service was terrific.   Everything was so good, we ended up staying for some dessert as well, and oh my, was it wonderful.Really nice people, nice atmosphere, and a good value.   Highly recommend it if you are in the area.

fjlLe0Sd8lQP8ZchuQ0_jA.text: Lovely breakfast. Though I am not a vegetarian this breakfast sounded delicious (see photo).  My friend enjoyed her omelette as well.  Service was excellent and warm.  They made us feel like we were special guests. 100% recommend and I look forward to having breakfast and coffee at Bonus Gusto tomorrow.  P.S. the coffee and espresso is delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Bon Gusto - London, United Kingdom. Perfectly prepared breakfast.

pPhiq-AK55UmEHJUbhqyiA.text: Great place for breakfast. I was looking for a place that was open at 8:30 AM on a Sunday in Westminster and had initially found a different place on Yelp, but it was closed, so I quickly checked Yelp again and found this one. Despite being an Italian cafe, they do have a full English breakfast on their menu, which I ordered since that is what I was what I was planning on having anyways. (They also have an Italian take on the traditional English breakfast, substituting Italian cuts of meat for the bacon for instance.) Either coffee or tea is included in the meal; I ordered a cappuccino, it being an Italian cafe and all. Buttered sourdough toast is also included.The breakfast had two eggs, cherry tomatoes, bacon, sausage, baked beans, mushrooms, and a hash brown. Everything was cooked well and appropriately seasoned. The coffee was also pretty good.

g79oy_2duDWLzZFlStyNEQ.text: A very cute little Italian British diner right around the corner from my hotel. I got the breakfast with eggs and vegetables and the service was very friendly.  The food came quickly as well.  I found the amount of oil they use in British food a bit heavy but otherwise food was good.
